links.title: Some Thoughts on Netflix
links.description: Trading at 214x earnings and 11x revenue, Netflix is significantly overvalued as investors are irrationally focused on growth metrics as opposed to fundamentals. I believe it's highly likely that the equity price could collapse in the medium term. Netflix investment value. NFLX. Value Investing.

messages.body: Today's insight on $AAPL https://app.seasonaledge.com/tools/I/AAPL
$OLED http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-5981721/China-targeting-Apple-advanced-OLED-screens-future-iPhones.html $AAPL $SSNLF

links.title: China is targeting Apple with advanced OLED screens for future iPhones
links.description: BOE Technology Group already builds displays for Apple iPads and MacBooks However, it is now planning to provide Apple with OLED smartphone screens The move could see China join the likes of South Korea and Japan in a race to create the most advanced display technology to court companies like Apple Chinese manufacturer BOE Technology Group is developing advanced organic light-emitting diode (OLED) displays, which it hopes will be used in Apple's top-tier smartphone range.

messages.body: $OLED https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-iphone-x-dark-mode-pure-black-apps-oled-2018-7 $AAPL

links.title: Apple put together a list of the 16 best apps with a 'pure black mode' to help you get the most out of the iPhone X's gorgeous OLED display
links.description: Apple's App Store editors created a list called "Does This App Come In Black?", which highlights 16 apps that have a "pure black mode." Darker themes are softer on the eyes, but apps with a pure-black mode are also a great way to take advantage of the gorgeous OLED display on the iPhone X.

messages.body: $OLED Apple's MacBook screen supplier wants a piece of the OLED iPhone business. https://iphone.appleinsider.com/articles/18/07/23/apples-macbook-screen-supplier-wants-a-piece-of-the-oled-iphone-screen-supply $AAPL $SSNLF $LPL

links.title: Apple's MacBook screen supplier wants a piece of the OLED iPhone business
links.description: Apple's MacBook and iPad screen vendor is looking to challenge Samsung's and LG's OLED stranglehold for the iPhone, giving Apple yet another supplier to leverage in price negotiations. BOE Technology has supplied displays for Apple since 2015, and is the worlds largest producer of laptop LCD displays.
